column4: Hey, how do I get sudo -user somebody to get all of "somebody"'s environment like it does in CentOS?
Hey, how do I get sudo -u somebody to get all of "somebody"'s environment like it does in CentOS?
su username     that will "switch users" to that username...
That doesn't give me the environment .  Try it.
I do not understand what you are asking
But I need to execute stuff.
if you type  "su somebody"  you will be that person, and have their environment
I am trying to execute something under someone's environment from another user that has sudo access.
Nope.  You only get it completely if you use su - user
Nope.  That works on CentOS, but not on Ubuntu.
Yes, but that is ugly.  I don't need to leave the machine.
